channel.title: Official client?
channel.description: Just downloaded official moparscape client...and for some reason it doesn't have a 'run' file with it anymore? How am I supposed to get on the client now..? Thanks For Helping =P

item.title: Official client?
item.dc:creator: @mopar_fan mopar fan
item.description:
@mopar_fan wrote:

I have the latest JRE, & JDK. Could you link me to the page to fix my problem?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 01, 2010, 08:08:56 pm[/size][hr]Nvm, fixed it myself… Searched the entire site & google & couldn’t find anything what I did was copy & paste java from C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin … and put it with the client’s files…For compiling , I guess I’d just copy & paste my JDK’s java…but I have nothing to compile atm…

Read full topic

item.title: Official client?
item.dc:creator: @bballin24 bballin24
item.description:
@bballin24 wrote:

mopar fan:

Nope, it is not there at all. But, nevermind. I found the run file…it’s in a different place than it used to be…so I couldn’t find it. ( used to all be in one file…) Anyways I got it working and up , but then everytime I double click on it, it closes automatically, so fast that I cannot read it. So, I edited it and put ‘pause’ in it. So every time I try to open the run file for moparscape, ( or any other client) I get this error: ‘Java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue… Could anyone help me with this? I tryed searching it up on google…but found no solution, there was something on here, but I need noob language =P I don’t add anything to environment variables ever or class variables…Thankyou For Your Help =P

download the newest jre thats a fix sometimes and for the environment variables its quite eazy thers no better way to explain it then the way they have done it on here

Read full topic
